content:
TITLE: Executing Android Release Build
DESCRIPTION: This command triggers the 'release' lane for the Android platform within fastlane. It is likely configured to deploy a new version of the app to the Google Play Store. The command requires a configured Fastfile with appropriate deployment credentials and metadata.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
fastlane android release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing iOS Release Build
DESCRIPTION: This command triggers the 'release' lane for the iOS platform within fastlane. It is likely configured to deploy a new version of the app to the App Store. The command requires a configured Fastfile with appropriate deployment credentials and metadata.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
fastlane ios release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing iOS Beta Build
DESCRIPTION: This command triggers the 'beta' lane for the iOS platform within fastlane. It is likely configured to submit a new beta build to Apple TestFlight and update the provisioning profile. This command requires a properly configured Fastfile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
fastlane ios beta
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Android Beta Build
DESCRIPTION: This command triggers the 'beta' lane for the Android platform within fastlane. It is likely configured to upload a new beta build to a beta testing service (e.g., Google Play Console internal testing). This command requires a properly configured Fastfile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
fastlane android beta
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing iOS Development Build
DESCRIPTION: This command triggers the 'dev' lane for the iOS platform within fastlane. It is likely configured to build a development version of the iOS app and update the provisioning profile. The command should be run from the project's root directory where the Fastfile is located.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
fastlane ios dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Android Development Build
DESCRIPTION: This command triggers the 'dev' lane for the Android platform within fastlane. It is likely configured to build a development version of the Android app. The command should be run from the project's root directory where the Fastfile is located.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
fastlane android dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Detox Android Tests - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command executes Detox tests on the Android platform. It is executed from the `detox` directory. An optional path to a specific test file can be included to run only that test.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/detox/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run e2e:android-test
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# To run a particular tests

npm run e2e:android-test <path to test file>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Detox iOS Tests - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command executes Detox tests on the iOS platform.  It is run from the `detox` directory. A path to a specific test file can be provided to run a single test.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/detox/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run e2e:ios-test
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# To run a particular tests

npm run e2e:android-test path to test file.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Build Detox Android App - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the Detox Android application. It is executed within the `detox` directory. The resulting debug APK is located at `android/app/build/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/detox/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run e2e:android-build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Build iOS Simulator - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the iOS simulator for Detox testing.  It is executed from the `detox` directory. The resulting simulator .zip file is created at the project root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/detox/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run e2e:ios-build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Build Detox Android App Settings Injection - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This script injects necessary settings for the Detox Android app build process.  It is executed from the `detox` folder. It configures the application for testing purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/detox/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run e2e:android-inject-settings
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing iOS Build
DESCRIPTION: This command triggers the 'build' lane for the iOS platform within fastlane. Its specific function depends on how it's configured in the Fastfile, but is likely configured to build the app. This command requires a properly configured Fastfile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
fastlane ios build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create Android Emulator - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This script creates an Android emulator with specified SDK version and AVD name.  The AVD name can be chosen freely. Optional flags such as `--headless` and `--debug` modify the emulator's behavior (headless mode, debug logs).
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/detox/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
./create_android_emulator.sh SDK_VERSION AVD_NAME
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# example ./create_android_emulator.sh 34 pixel_5a_avd
# example ./create_android_emulator.sh 34 pixel_5a_avd --headless
# If we want to see the emulator logs. Run it in debug mode example ./create_android_emulator.sh 34 pixel_5a_avd --debug
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with npm - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the required dependencies for the project using npm.  It is executed from the root directory of the project. This step is crucial before running any further commands related to building or testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/detox/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Profile Links in Mattermost Mobile (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates how to configure a custom profile link in the Mattermost mobile application. The `ProfileLinks` array allows adding custom buttons to a user's profile.  The example configures a link labeled "Whober" that navigates to a custom URL, replacing `{email}` with the user's email. Requires a valid URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/docs/base_configs.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
    "ProfileLinks": [
        {
            "type": "link",
            "defaultMessage": "Whober",
            "textId": "user_profile.custom_link.whober",
            "icon": "account-outline",
            "url": "https://www.custompage.com/{email}/view"
        }
    ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Fastlane
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the fastlane tool using RubyGems. Fastlane automates mobile app deployment tasks. The command requires sudo privileges to install the gem globally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/fastlane/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
sudo gem install fastlane
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create mobile-artifacts directory - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a directory named `mobile-artifacts` in the root of the project.  This directory is used to store the unzipped iOS simulator app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/detox/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# From project root
mkdir mobile-artifacts
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: YAML Configuration for Notice.txt Generation
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration file defines the settings used to generate the Notice.txt file for Mattermost Mobile. It specifies the application title, copyright information, description, reviewers, dependencies, development dependencies, and the search paths for `package.json` files. This configuration ensures that all necessary open-source licenses are included in the generated Notice.txt file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/build/notice-file/Readme.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
title: "Mattermost Mobile"
copyright: "Â© 2016-present Mattermost, Inc.  All Rights Reserved.  See LICENSE.txt for license information."
description: "This document includes a list of open source components used in Mattermost Mobile, including those that have been modified."
reviewers:
  - mattermost/release-managers
  - enahum
search:
  - "package.json"
dependencies:
  - "wix"
devDependencies:
  - "webpack"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: MIT License Text
DESCRIPTION: This is the standard MIT License text. It grants permissions for usage, modification, and distribution of the software with certain conditions. The license includes a copyright notice and a disclaimer of warranty.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/NOTICE.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
copies or substantial portions of the Software.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
SOFTWARE.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ISC License Text
DESCRIPTION: This is the standard ISC License text. It grants permissions for usage, modification, and distribution of the software for any purpose with or without fee. The license includes a copyright notice and a disclaimer of warranty.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-mobile/blob/main/NOTICE.txt#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
Permission to use, copy, modify, and/or distribute this software for any purpose with or without fee is hereby granted, provided that the above copyright notice and this permission notice appear in all copies.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND THE AUTHOR DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES WITH REGARD TO THIS SOFTWARE INCLUDING ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR ANY DAMAGES WHATSOEVER RESULTING FROM LOSS OF USE, DATA OR PROFITS, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE OR OTHER TORTIOUS ACTION, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS SOFTWARE.
```
